review_title: Oldest Community-based agency non-profit in New Hampshire
pros: Programs are client driven- serving New Hampshire's most at-risk youth and youth homelessness in a client-centered non-judgemental manner. Embraced innovative thinking to address community needs
cons: can feel isolated as programs are all over the State. Efforts made to encourage and develop increased inter-agency collaboration. certain programs high turnover

pros: Community Based Voluntary Services (CBVS) has the potential to help families in need.
cons: If you want to be bullied and gaslit by management, this is the place for you! CBVS is a brand new program that takes bachelor-level employees and attempts to educate them to function on a master's "therapeutic" level (though many employees are not informed of this prior to hiring). The managers of CBVS (those that work above the supervisor II level) are bullies and have no business being the managers of one of Waypoint's largest programs. They are entirely out of touch with reality, care nothing about their employees, and need months of proper leadership training. The CBVS program is failing, and leadership is not willing to listen to employee feedback. If you want to have your ideas ignored, be bullied by management, and question what you're doing to help families, work here.

pros: The idea of the CBVS program is great. Waypoint benefits are great. Waypoint warmup is fun. Mostly everyone seems nice and fair and here for the right reasons.
cons: Low morale and constant staff turnover in CBVS despite plenty of caring and motivated staff. This rapid exodus Is due to the walk on eggshells environment. Regional supervisors are professional, caring, and empathetic, but upper management is not responsive to employee feedback regarding problems created by the aggressive program management style within CBVS. There is strong program emphasis on learning and using masters level clinical skills which are beyond the skill and degree level of the employees. The push for good data competes with the worker’s ability to put client’s needs first. Waypoint salaries are on the low side, but it still has many great programs to consider for employment outside of the CBVS program.

pros: Good pay and benefit package
cons: The coffee is horrible and smells like yick

review_title: More interested in *looking* like a good
pros: Caring direct support staff, overall the people doing the hands on work (not management) are wonderful
cons: More interested in *looking* like a good company rather then being one. They put a lot of energy in appearing like a good place to work rather than just making it enjoyable. Any community building or fun activities they plan are only offered during your unpaid lunch break, because the culture is work you into the ground. Unless of course your a manager-then you get to do whatever you want, come in late, leave early, and have long meetings with food discussing work for subordinates to do…

review_title: Exciting to be a part of
job_title: Family Support Worker in Rochester, NH
pros: Waypoint is an amazing organization with an equally amazing and important mission. The organization from top to bottom and in every direction is welcoming and laid back, yet very mission focused. I am beyond excited to be a part of the newest program at Waypoint, because not only do I feel it is an important program and role, but Waypoint makes me feel like a valued employee and like my role is just as important to me and those I am working with as it is to them, and the successes of the families I work with, and the professional and personal growth I experience is celebrated. Come work with CBVS, a growing and amazing team here sharing an amazing goal!
cons: I have yet to find a con!

pros: Great company overall, the CEO's are awesome :)
cons: can't think of too many!

review_title: On staff for a little over 2 years, enjoy my job
pros:
I am a full time employee and I get full benefits, including health and dental insurance, paid time off (sick, vacation, and personal time), as well as being able to contribute to the 403b retirement plan. 
My boss was very accommodating with my needs during the COVID-19 Pandemic. I was able to continue my job 100% remotely and did not lose any hours during the time. 
I feel that I am a valuable part of the team and am often asked to contribute my ideas.
I have received a generous bonus in the past around the holidays, as well as have been able to sell back some unused vacation time which helps a lot with bills. 
I find most of the supervisors and directors to be approachable when I have concerns or needs.
cons: Because it is a non-profit, salary is always a challenge.

pros: Great work done for families
cons: Can be stressful, emotional work

pros: welcoming environment, lots of training available, very nice executive team
cons: company is so concerned with "DEI" that they do not hold employees accountable for not meeting job requirements or being good at their job

pros: Great, supportive, mission driven work
cons: Lower pay scale, but that's to be expected in at a nonprofit.

pros: Gave employee discounts on products
cons: Profits above everything else, does not value experience, and employees. After being there for over 5 years, was hardly earning more then someone coming on board with no experience.

pros: Great atmosphere and staff to work with.
cons: There were no cons that I can mention.

pros: Great supervision with excellent opportunities for training and personal growth. Down to earth CEO who truly understands what it means to work in the trenches. I’m thrilled to have the opportunity to do social work the way it was intended.
cons: Nothing so far that I’m worried about.

pros:
As a new employee I am very impressed with onboarding process and support received from HR, IT, and management. 
New hires are immediately trained on the technology and logistics of the program. 
We receive good training before entering the field.
cons: I have no cons to share.

pros:
Flexible managers 
Lots of opportunity for growth 
Good pay
cons: Wish I could’ve had more hours

job_title: Family Engagement Coordinator in Keene, NH
pros: All levels of management take time to engage with employees. They are genuinely interested in your concerns and successes!
cons: I've not had any negative experiences.

review_title: Great place to work if you love helping others.
job_title: Family Support Specialist in Manchester, NH
pros: Strong confidence in the President and VP to continue to make the jobs better for the employees in the future. Services to the client are a priority. Healthy and supportive work environment. Paid time off and availability of training opportunities is good. Responsive to community needs, always evolving.
cons: Constant employee turnover due to low salary. Not interested in trying to retain employees - attitude is more like there will always be someone to fill the position. Would like to see investment into retirement plan and social activities.

pros: Flexible work schedule, feel good work helping people, ample paid time off, nice people work there - employees are great.
cons: You are just a number, it is made clear that you are replaceable, nothing is done to keep you happy and motivated so many look elsewhere. Pay is very low for most jobs. They include dental, vision ect as a list of benefits but all it means is you have the right to enroll and pay for it 100% - why is that a benefit.

pros: Everyone working there truly enjoys helping others. We all have our own personalities but at the end of the day, everyone was there for the same reason.
cons: Social work and non-profit organizations aren't known for paying well. You must love the work.

job_title: Family Support Worker in Manchester, NH
pros: The support and flexibility for staff are great. This is a company that does care about and listen to its employees.
cons: In the non-profit world, salaries are low.

pros: Great opportunity, and travel throughout NH.
cons: lack of supervision, and inconsistency with DHHS communication, and regulations.

pros:
Flexible Hours and 
Mileage Reimbursement
cons: Paperwork demands and the fact that it's handwritten.
